article.headline: Southern U. 55, Alabama St. 53
article.story: MONTGOMERY, Ala. -- Derick Beltran scored 22 points and Southern University rallied to beat Alabama State 55-53 on Monday night. The Jaguars (15-13, 11-4 Southwestern Athletic Conference) trailed 44-38 with 6:37 remaining before going on a 14-2 run. They scored six straight to cap the run, going up 52-46 on Quinton Doggett's free throw with 21 seconds left. During the Hornets' 1:21 scoring drought, they missed all six of their field goals. Southern shot 45.5 percent from the field in the second half (10 of 22), while Alabama State shot just 9 of 27 in the final 20 minutes. Doggett finished with 18 points and three blocks for the Jaguars. Tramaine Butler was the only player in double figures for Alabama State (10-16, 7-7) with 18 points. Butler was 4 of 8 from 3-point range, as the Hornets shot just 28.6 percent from behind the arc (6 of 21).

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
